eu.trentorise.smartcampus.osm.android.bonuspack.location

Class NominatimPOIProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.trentorise.smartcampus.osm.android.bonuspack.location.NominatimPOIProvider

  • public class NominatimPOIProvider
extends java.lang.Object
    POI Provider using Nominatim service.
    See http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Nominatim
    and http://open.mapquestapi.com/nominatim/
    Author:
    M.Kergall

      • getThem

        public java.util.ArrayList<POI> getThem(java.lang.String url)
        Parameters:
        url - full URL request
        Returns:
        the list of POI, of null if technical issue.

      • getPOICloseTo

        public java.util.ArrayList<POI> getPOICloseTo(GeoPoint position,
                                     java.lang.String facility,
                                     int maxResults,
                                     double maxDistance)
        Parameters:
        position -
        facility - a Nominatim facility. Note that Nominatim facility search uses Special Phrases instead of OSM tags. See http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Nominatim/Special_Phrases and http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Nominatim/Special_Phrases/EN or http://code.google.com/p/osmbonuspack/source/browse/trunk/OSMBonusPackDemo/res/values/poi_tags.xml
        maxResults - the maximum number of POI returned. Note that in any case, Nominatim will have an absolute maximum of 50.
        maxDistance - to the position, in degrees. Note that it is used to build a bounding box around the position, not a circle.
        Returns:
        the list of POI, null if technical issue.

      • getPOIInside

        public java.util.ArrayList<POI> getPOIInside(BoundingBoxE6 boundingBox,
                                    java.lang.String facility,
                                    int maxResults)
        Parameters:
        boundingBox -
        facility - Nominatim facility
        maxResults -
        Returns:
        list of POIs, null if technical issue.

      • getPOIAlong

        public java.util.ArrayList<POI> getPOIAlong(java.util.ArrayList<GeoPoint> path,
                                   java.lang.String facility,
                                   int maxResults,
                                   double maxWidth)
        Parameters:
        path - Warning: a very long path may cause a failure due to the url to be too long. Using a simplified route may help (see Road.getRouteLow()).
        facility - Nominatim feature
        maxResults -
        maxWidth - to the path. Certainly not in degrees. Probably in km.
        Returns:
        list of POIs, null if technical issue.
